sense.name: delay, cease or slow motion
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[agent] STALL NP2[patient] Includes: STALL OUT
sense.examples: He wasn't ready to get engaged so he stalled by buying her a 'promise ring'. If she'd stalled him with a court order, she could still buy the boys' time. He stalled the convertible letting out the clutch. I was parking my truck when it stalled and died in reverse. I have a 1990 plymouth sundance that stalled out yesterday. The Safe Motherhood Initiative: why has it stalled? The car stalled out soon after starting.

sense.name: (cause to) lose lift because of interrupted airflow
sense.examples: Mann apparently stalled the plane as he tried to return to the field. At approximately 45 degrees through the turn, the plane stalled out.

sense.name: put into or keep in a stall
sense.examples: The rider noticed swelling in the right hind leg and promptly stalled the horse.
